name: wheedling
content:

trying to persuade someone to do something by saying nice things about them: I knew by your wheedling tone that you wanted something from me. His wheedling phone call irritated her. See
wheedle
More examplesFewer examplesHis mother wrote him long, wheedling letters.A wheedling voice came through the keyhole.She didn't answer, and his tone became softer and more wheedling.

the act of trying to persuade someone to do something by saying nice things about them: The rule will spare you endless wheedling and whining from your child. By patient wheedling and soft talk I managed to persuade her. See
wheedle
More examplesFewer examplesWheedling was not going to produce a different answer, she decided.After five minutes of wheedling, they relent.
